gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls
Class FieldEntryControl

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.UI.ActiveJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.ViewControl
                          gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.FieldEntryControl
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, IViewControl, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class FieldEntryControl
extends ViewControl

This class is a ViewControl (ActiveJPanel) with labels and input text fields set up for the user to input values. Since the radio button labels are used as keys, no setLabel() method is available. Instead, a removeRadioChoice() and addRadioChoice() must be done.

The methods getFloatValue(int) and getAllFloatValues() can be used to obtain the data from the text fields on this ViewControl. Then, before processing the data, it can be analyzed to make sure that the data is numeric. If a given value is not numeric the specified methods will return Float.NaN. Otherwise the actual value is returned.

However, filters can also be applied to any or all of the text fields on the ViewControl using the methods enableFilter(StringFilter, int) and enableAllFilters(StringFilter[]). Notice that each textfield can be given its own filter. As a result, one text field might only accept integers while another might only accept floats. Also, if a filter is enabled on a textfield, the user is physically not allowed to enter an invalid value in the textfield.

See Also:
Serialized Form

FieldEntryControl

public FieldEntryControl(java.lang.String[] name,
                         java.lang.String[] values)
This constructor will be used to create a control with labels and an array of some or all String default values. There does not have to be a value for every label, but values will always be assigned from the beginning. This constructor should be used if defaults are desired but some fields are numeric and others are non-numeric.

Parameters:
name - An array of String labels, one for each text area.
values - An array of String default values.

setControlValue

public void setControlValue(java.lang.Object value)
This method will set all the values in the field entry control given an an array of Strings. Since values can be parsed later, use strings for generic purposes. The first entry of the String[] must refer to the radio button that is selected. If no radio buttons have been added to the control, pass in null for the first array value.

Specified by:
setControlValue in interface IViewControl
Specified by:
setControlValue in class ViewControl
Parameters:
value - String[] of field entry values.

getControlValue

public java.lang.Object getControlValue()
Get String[] containing the selected radio button and all values in the field entries. Parsing the value strings is done within this control to determine if the strings are numeric values. If no radio buttons have been added to the control, null is the first element of the array.

Specified by:
getControlValue in interface IViewControl
Specified by:
getControlValue in class ViewControl
Returns:
Array containing the selected radio button and all values in the field entries.

getAllFloatValues

public float[] getAllFloatValues()
This function gets all of the float values of all the text areas. Use this method only if ALL of the values are numeric.

Returns:
An array of float values, ordered the same as the textfields. If a value in not numeric, Float.NaN is returned in its place.

getAllStringValues

public java.lang.String[] getAllStringValues()
This function gets all of the String values of all the text areas. Use this if some or all of the text areas contain non-numeric text.

Returns:
An array of String values, ordered the same as the textfields.

resetLabels

public void resetLabels(java.lang.String[] labels)
Use this method to reset the labels. If the number of labels exceeds the number of text fields, the extra labels are ignored. If there are not enough labels to fill the text fields, the unfilled text fields are disabled and cleared.

Parameters:
labels - The new labels for the text fields.

clearAllValues

public void clearAllValues()
Use this method to clear all of the values in the control.

setSelected

public void setSelected(java.lang.String radiolabel)
This method will select the radio button with the given label. This will also update the textfield labels to the new selection.

Parameters:
radiolabel - The label of the radio button to be selected.

getSelected

public java.lang.String getSelected()
This method will return the label of the selected JRadioButton.

Returns:
The label of the selected radio button. Returns null if no radio buttons have been added to the control.

addRadioChoice

public void addRadioChoice(java.lang.String radiolabel,
                           java.lang.String[] new_labels)
This method is used to add a radio button which will provide alternate labels to the fields. Use this method if the labels for the new radio button are unique from any other radio button.

Parameters:
radiolabel - The label on the radio button.
new_labels - A list of new labels for the text fields. If the list is shorter than the amount set by the constructor, the remaining fields will be disabled. If the list is too long, the exceeding values will be ignored.

addRadioChoice

public void addRadioChoice(java.lang.String radiolabel,
                           java.lang.String[] new_labels,
                           int index)
This method is used to add a radio button which will provide alternate labels to the fields. Use this method if the labels for the new radio button are unique from any other radio button.

Parameters:
radiolabel - The label on the radio button.
new_labels - A list of new labels for the text fields. If the list is shorter than the amount set by the constructor, the remaining fields will be disabled. If the list is too long, the exceeding values will be ignored.
index - The index where this radio button should be inserted.

addRadioChoice

public void addRadioChoice(java.lang.String radiolabel,
                           java.lang.String same_labels)
This method is used to add a radio button which will provide alternate labels to the fields. Use this method if the new radio button has the same labels as another already existing radio button.

Parameters:
radiolabel - The label on the radio button.
same_labels - A String label of an already existing radio button. This will use the new labels of that radio button.

removeRadioChoice

public void removeRadioChoice(java.lang.String radiolabel)
This method is used to remove a radio button choice.

Parameters:
radiolabel - The label on the radio button.

setButtonText

public void setButtonText(java.lang.String text)
This method sets the label on the Enter or Submit button.

Parameters:
text - Desired text for this button.

removeButton

public void removeButton()
Under some situations, a graphical component could be created that uses an object of this type but does not want the "Enter" button attached to it. This method can be used to remove the "Enter" button from this graphical component.

Note: Currently, if the "Enter" button is removed, it cannot be added back onto the gui.

enableFilter

public void enableFilter(StringFilter filter,
                         int index)
Used to attach the given filter to the editable textfield specified by the given index. Note: If index is invalid, nothing is done.

Parameters:
filter - The filter to attach to the textfield. If this is null, the textfield will instead have filtering disabled.
index - The index specifying which textfield to attach the filter to.
  • If 'n' is the number of textfields on this component that the user can use to enter information, then index must be in the range [0,n) to be valid.

enableAllFilters

public void enableAllFilters(StringFilter[] filters)
Used to attach filters to all of the editable textfields on this component.

Parameters:
filters - The filters to attach to the textfields.
  • If filters==null filtering is disabled for every textfield on this component.
  • Otherwise, the ith filter in the array is attached to the ith textfield on the component. Here, indexing starts at 0 as usual. Thus, the first textfield on the component is textfield 0.
  • Note: If this array contains fewer filters than there are textfields, nothing is done to the extra textfields. Also, if this array contains more filters than there are textfields, the extra filters are ignored.
  • Also, using null for a filter has the effect of disabeling filtering for the corresponding textfield.

disableFilter

public void disableFilter(int index)
Used to disable filtering on the editable textfield identified by the given index. Note: If index is invalid, nothing is done.

Parameters:
index - The index specifying which textfield onto which filtering is disabled.
  • If 'n' is the number of textfields on this component that the user can use to enter information, then index must be in the range [0,n) to be valid.

disableAllFilters

public void disableAllFilters()
Used to disable filtering for each editable textfield on this component.

getFilter

public StringFilter getFilter(int index)
Used to retrieve the filter used to filter the textfield specified by the given index.

Parameters:
index - The index specifying which textfield to attach the filter to.
  • If 'n' is the number of textfields on this component that the user can use to enter information, then index must be in the range [0,n) to be valid.
Returns:
If index is valid, the filter used to filter the textfield specified by index is returned. Note: If the specified textfield does not have filtering enabled, null as the filter.
  • If index is invalid, null is returned.

getAllFilters

public StringFilter[] getAllFilters()
Used to get all of the filters used to filter each editable textfield on this component.

Returns:
An array of the filters used to filter each textfield on this component. Note: If the ith element of this array is null then the ith editable textfield on this component does not have filtering enabled (here normal indexing -- starting at 0 -- is used).

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Test purposes only... If "cm" is passed as an argument, the ControlManager will link controls.
